rules: Rule1: If the experimental drug demonstrates safety in human subjects, then the experimental drug demonstrates efficacy against the target disease
Rule2: If the clinical trial meets sample size requirements for statistical validity, then the clinical trial achieves sufficient power in statistical analysis
Rule3: The clinical trial meets sample size requirements for statistical validity or the clinical trial maintains compliance with ethical standards
Rule4: If the clinical trial maintains compliance with ethical standards, then the experimental drug demonstrates safety in human subjects
Rule5: If the clinical trial achieves sufficient power in statistical analysis, then the clinical trial shows statistical significance for the primary endpoint
Rule6: The research institution secures funding through a government grant or the research institution secures funding through private investment

Rule7: If the research institution secures funding through private investment, then the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the European Union or the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the Global Health Organization

Rule8: The clinical trial faces regulatory challenges from local authorities or if the research institution secures funding through a government grant, then the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the European Union or the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the Global Health Organization

Rule9: The clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the United States or the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the European Union or the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the Global Health Organization
Rule10: The clinical trial completes Phase III or the clinical trial completes Phase II

Rule11: If the clinical trial completes Phase II, then the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from China or the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the Global Health Organization

Rule12: If the research team publishes results of the clinical trial, then if the clinical trial completes Phase III, then the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from China or the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the Global Health Organization
Rule13: The research team publishes results of the clinical trial or the research team submits documentation to regulatory bodies
Rule14: If the research team submits documentation to regulatory bodies, then the medical journal peer reviews the clinical trial

Rule15: If the medical journal peer reviews the clinical trial, then if the clinical trial completes Phase III, then the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from China or the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the Global Health Organization
Rule16: If the experimental drug demonstrates efficacy against the target disease, then the clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the Global Health Organization
facts: Fact1: The clinical trial does not receive regulatory approval from the European Union
Fact2: The clinical trial does not show statistical significance for the primary endpoint
Fact3: The clinical trial does not face regulatory challenges from local authorities
Fact4: The clinical trial does not receive regulatory approval from the United States
Fact5: The clinical trial does not receive regulatory approval from China

question: The clinical trial receives regulatory approval from the Global Health Organization
